text: Don Davis (October 25, 1938 â€“ June 5, 2014) was a Grammy Award-winning writer and record producer. Davis combined a music career with that of banking. He is known for producing "Money (That's What I Want)", "Bye Bye Baby", "Who's Making Love", and "Disco Lady". Davis was born in Detroit. He lived in West Bloomfield Township, north of Detroit. "Detroit music legend and banking entrepreneur Don Davis dies at age 75", The Detroit News, June 6, 2014. Retrieved June 7, 2014 Davis died there after a short illness in June 2014, aged 75. He is survived by a wife and three children. ==References== Category:Grammy Award winners Category:1938 births Category:2014 deaths Category:African-American musicians Category:American record producers Category:Businesspeople from Michigan Category:Disease-related deaths in Michigan Category:Businesspeople from Detroit
title: Don Davis (record producer)
